turn.2: Halifax Windjammers The Halifax Windjammers were a franchise in the World Basketball League that began play in 1991.
turn.3: When did the team relocate to Nova Scotia?
turn.4: The team continued operation after the WBL folded in 1992, when they joined the newly formed National Basketball League.
turn.5: Did the team win a championship?
turn.6: The NBL folded midway through the 1994 season, when the Windjammers were in first place.
turn.7: Where did the team play their home games?
turn.8: The team played their home games at the Halifax Metro Centre.
turn.9: Did the team have any star players?
turn.10: The most famous player to ever suit up for the 'Jammers was Keith Smart, who scored the game winning basket in the 1987 NCAA championship game.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Milt Newton won the 1991 WBL Slam Dunk contest as a member of the Windjammers while Willie Bland led the league in rebounding in the same year (at 12.3 per game).
